sentences.text: Shareholder Nominations to Our Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Constitution, no person is eligible for appointment as a director at any general meeting of shareholders (including an ncumbent director), without the recommendation of our Board for election; except for persons proposed by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) a shareholder or shareholders who in aggregate hold(s) more than 50% of the total number of our issued and paid-up ordinary shares (excluding treasury shares), which shareholder or shareholders, not less than 10 days before, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) a shareholder or shareholders who in aggregate hold(s) more than five percent of the total number of our issued and paid-up ordinary shares (excluding treasury shares), which shareholder or shareholders, not less than 120 days before, the date of the notice provided to shareholders in connection with the general meeting odges at our registered office in Singapore a written notice signed by such shareholder or shareholders (other than the person to be proposed for appointment), who
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) are qualified to attend and vote at the meeting for which such notice is given, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) have held ordinary shares representing the prescribed threshold in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) above, for a continuous period of at least one year prior to the date on which such notice is given.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such a notice must also include the consent to serve as a director of the person nominated, as well as the nformation specified below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of our ordinary shares can recommend qualified candidates for our Board by submitting recommendations to our General Counsel, c/o Avago Technologies U.S. Inc., 1320 Ridder Park Drive, San Jose, CA 95131, U.S.A. Submissions that include the following requirements will be forwarded to our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee for review and consideration:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the candidates name and personal and business addresses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a resume or curriculum vitae describing the candidates principal occupation, business experience, education and other relevant qualifications, and an explanation that clearly indicates how he or she has the necessary experiences, skills and qualifications to serve as a director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a description of any relationship, agreement or understanding between the candidate or any affiliate of the candidate and any customer, supplier or competitor of our, or any other relationship or understanding that might be relevant to a determination of the independence of the candidate as director, or affect the independent status of our independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a statement as to whether or not, during the past 10 years, the candidate has been convicted in a criminal proceeding (excluding minor traffic violations) and, if so, the dates, the nature of the conviction, the name or other disposition of the case, and whether the individual has been involved in any other legal proceeding during the past 10 years, and any other information that would be required under SEC rules to be included a proxy statement soliciting proxies for the election of such candidate as a director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a signed statement from the candidate that he or she consents to serve on our Board if elected and that he or she is not disqualified under the Singapore Companies Act from acting as a director; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a statement from the person submitting the candidate that he or she is the registered holder of ordinary shares, or if the shareholder is not the registered holder, a written statement from the record holder of the ordinary shares (usually a broker or bank) verifying that at the time the shareholder submitted the candidate that he or she was a beneficial owner of ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualified director candidates suggested by holders of our ordinary shares will be evaluated in the same manner as any other candidate for election to our Board (other than those standing for re-election).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethics and Business Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has adopted a Code of Ethics and Business Conduct that is applicable to all members of our Board, executive officers and employees, including our Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and principal accounting officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Code of Ethics and Business Conduct is available in the Investor CenterCorporate Governance section of our website (http://investors.broadcom.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=203541&p=irol-govhighlights) under Documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may also request a copy in print from: Investor Relations, c/o Avago Technologies U.S. Inc., 1320 Ridder Park Drive, San Jose, CA 95131, U.S.A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is committed to using sound corporate governance practices to help fulfill our responsibilities to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, our Board has adopted formal Corporate Governance Guidelines to clarify how it exercises its responsibilities and provide a ramework within which it will conduct its business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Corporate Governance Guidelines is available in the Investor Center Corporate Governance section of our website (http://investors.broadcom.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=203541&p=irol-govhighlights) under Documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may also request a copy in print from: Investor Relations, c/o Avago Technologies U.S. Inc., 1320 Ridder Park Drive, San Jose, CA 95131, U.S.A. Among the policies included in our Corporate Governance Guidelines are the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors with Significant Job Change
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director who retires from his or her present employment, or who materially changes his or her position, is required to submit an offer of resignation as a director of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board will then evaluate whether the individual should continue to sit on our Board in light of his or her new occupational status and decide whether or not to accept the directors offer of resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors Offer of Resignation at Age 75
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board does not currently believe that a mandatory retirement age for non-employee directors is necessary, and that continued service by a particular director may be in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders, regardless of such directors age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, when a non-employee director reaches the age of 75 years, he or she is required to offer his or her resignation to our Board, to be effective as of the next annual general meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board will determine, based on individual circumstances, the needs of our Board and the interests of our Company and its shareholders, whether or not to accept such resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, no person would be eligible to stand for election or re-election to our Board after attaining the age of 75 without being specifically nominated as a candidate by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Share Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director share ownership guidelines, as adopted in February 2016, encourage our non-employees directors to hold our ordinary shares having a fair market value equal to three times the annual cash retainer paid to non-employee directors for service on our Board (which amounts to $240,000 currently), measured using the closing price per ordinary share as quoted on the Nasdaq Global Select Market on the date of valuation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outstanding restricted share units (RSUs) held by a director count in full toward achieving the guideline level of share ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines encourage our non-employee directors to reach this goal by August 28, 2017 or within five years of the date of their appointment or election to our Board, whichever is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: later, and to hold at least such minimum value in shares for as long as he or she serves on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 8, 2017, all of our non-employee directors, other than Mr. Low, who was appointed to our Board in December 2016, had achieved the guideline level of share ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTORS COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-employee directors (which are those directors not employed by us or any subsidiary) receive cash and equity compensation in consideration for their service on our Board, as set forth in more detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors are reimbursed, or we pay, for travel and other out-of-pocket expenses related to their attendance at Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors do not receive any non-equity incentive compensation, or participate in any company pension plan or deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the laws of Singapore, our shareholders must approve all cash compensation paid to our non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not compensate our management directors for their service on our Board or any committee of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2: APPROVAL OF THE RE-APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM AND INDEPENDENT SINGAPORE AUDITOR FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017 AND AUTHORIZATION OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE TO FIX ITS REMUNERATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) is our independent registered public accounting firm in the United States and audits our consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During Fiscal Year 2016, PwC in Singapore was our independent Singapore auditor of our Singapore statutory financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 205(2) and 205(4) of the Singapore Companies Act, any appointment after our Boards initial appointment of our independent Singapore auditor, or its subsequent removal, requires the approval of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has approved, subject to shareholder approval, the re-appointment of PwC as our independent registered public accounting firm and independent Singapore auditor for the fiscal year ending October 29, 2017 (Fiscal Year 2017).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 205(16) of the Singapore Companies Act, the remuneration of a companys auditors shall be fixed by the shareholders in a general meeting or the shareholders may authorize directors to fix the remuneration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that it is appropriate for the Audit Committee, as part of its oversight responsibilities, to fix the auditors remuneration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is therefore also requesting that the shareholders authorize the Audit Committee to fix the auditors remuneration for services rendered through our 2018 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (the 2018 AGM).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect a representative from PwC to be present at the 2017 AGM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This representative will have the opportunity to make a statement if he or she so desires and is expected to be available to respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Accounting Fees and Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below are the audit fees for services rendered by PwC to us and Avago, our predecessor, relating to Fiscal Year 2016 and to Avago for the fiscal year ended November 1, 2015 (Fiscal Year 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Pre-Approval Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for selecting the independent registered public accounting firm to be employed by us to audit our financial statements, subject to approval by our shareholders of such appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also assumes responsibility for the retention, compensation, oversight and termination of any independent auditor employed by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All engagements with our independent registered accounting firm, regardless of amount, must be authorized in advance by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has delegated its pre-approval authority to the Chairperson of the Audit Committee, provided that any matters approved in such manner are presented to the Audit Committee at its next meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the charter of the Audit Committee, committee approval of non-audit services (other than review and attest services) is not required, if such services fall within available exceptions established by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, to date, the Audit Committees policy has been to approve all services provided by our independent registered accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm and our management are required to periodically report to the Audit Committee regarding the extent of services provided by the independent registered public accounting firm in accordance with the Audit Committees pre-approval, and the fees for the services performed to date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During Fiscal Year 2015 and Fiscal Year 2016, all services provided to either Avago or us by PwC were approved by the Audit Committee pursuant to paragraph (c)(7)(i) of Rule 2-01 of Regulation S-X.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends a vote FOR the resolution to approve of the re-appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm and independent Singapore auditor for Fiscal Year 2017 and to authorize the Audit Committee to fix its remuneration as described in the Notice.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3: ORDINARY RESOLUTION TO AUTHORIZE SHARE ALLOTMENTS AND ISSUANCES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are incorporated in the Republic of Singapore.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the laws of Singapore, our directors may issue shares and make offers or agreements or grant equity awards that might or would require the allotment and issuance of shares only with the prior approval of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are submitting this proposal to authorize our directors to allot and issue our shares from time to time, as set forth in the Notice, because we are required to do so under the laws of Singapore before we can issue any
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) ordinary shares in connection with our equity compensation plans, possible future strategic transactions, or public and private offerings or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Special Preference Shares in accordance with our Constitution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this proposal is approved, the authorization would be effective from the date of the 2017 AGM and continue until the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the conclusion of the 2018 AGM or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the expiration of the period within which the 2018 AGM is required by the laws of Singapore to be held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2018 AGM is required to be held no later than 15 months after the date of the 2017 AGM or six months after our financial year end, whichever is the earlier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The laws of Singapore allow for an application to be made with the Singapore Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority for an extension of up to an additional two months of the time in which to hold an annual general meeting of shareholders, which may be granted in the discretion of that Authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that it is advisable and in the best interests of our shareholders for our shareholders to authorize the directors to issue shares and to make offers or agreements or grant equity awards that might or would require the issuance of ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future, the directors may need to issue shares or make agreements that would require the allotment and issuance of new shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in connection with strategic transactions and acquisitions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: pursuant to public and private offerings of our ordinary shares, as well as instruments (including debt instruments) convertible into our ordinary shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in connection with our equity compensation plans and arrangements; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in respect of the Special Preference Shares, as required by our Constitution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding this general authorization to allot and issue our ordinary shares, we will be required to seek shareholder approval with respect to future issuances of ordinary shares, where required under the Nasdaq Stock Market rules, such as if we were to propose an issuance of ordinary shares that would result in a change in control of Broadcom or in connection with a transaction involving the issuance of ordinary shares representing 20% or more of our outstanding ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that we will continue to issue ordinary shares and grant equity-based awards in the future under circumstances similar to those in the past.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, other than issuances of ordinary shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) in connection with our equity compensation plans, awards and arrangements, including any equity compensation plans and awards we have assumed or may assume as a result of any acquisitions we have made or may make, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) as we may choose to issue in exchange for Restricted Units, we have no specific plans, agreements or commitments to issue any ordinary shares for which approval of this proposal is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, our Board believes that it is advisable and in the best interests of our shareholders for our shareholders to provide this general authorization in order to avoid the delay and expense of obtaining shareholder approval at a later date, and to provide us with greater flexibility to pursue strategic transactions and acquisitions and raise additional capital through public and private offerings of our ordinary shares, as well as instruments convertible into our ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will only issue additional Special Preference Shares if and to the extent required, and in the manner provided, by our Constitution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this proposal is approved, our directors would be authorized to allot and issue, during the period described above, shares subject to and in accordance with our Constitution, applicable Singapore laws and the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The issuance of a large number of ordinary shares (or instruments convertible into or exchangeable for ordinary shares) could be dilutive to existing shareholders or reduce the trading price of our ordinary shares on the Nasdaq Global Select Market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this proposal is not approved, we would not be permitted to issue shares (other than shares issuable on exercise or settlement of outstanding options, RSUs and other instruments convertible or exchangeable into, or exercisable for, ordinary shares or the like, which were previously granted when prior shareholder approved share issuance mandates were in effect).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we are unable to rely upon equity as a component of compensation, we would have to review our compensation practices, and would likely have to substantially increase cash compensation to retain key personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends a vote FOR the resolution to authorize share allotments and issuances as described in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4 NON-BINDING, ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are seeking a non-binding, advisory vote to approve the compensation of our named executive officers as described in Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 28 and in the tables and accompanying narrative disclosure under Executive Compensation beginning on page 49.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are encouraged to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and Executive Compensation sections of this Proxy Statement, which discuss our compensation policies, procedures and programs and the Fiscal Year 2016 compensation for our named executive officers listed in the Fiscal Year 2016 Summary Compensation Table included in the Executive Compensation section of the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends that shareholders vote FOR the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, that shareholders approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of Broadcoms named executive officers, as disclosed in Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the compensation tables and the accompanying narrative disclosure under Executive Compensation of the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the vote on this resolution is advisory and not binding on us, the Compensation Committee or our Board, the Compensation Committee and our Board values thoughtful input from shareholders and will consider the outcome of the vote on this resolution when considering future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed under Proposal 5, our Board has adopted a policy of providing for annual advisory votes from shareholders on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently expect to conduct the next advisory vote on executive compensation at our 2018 AGM, but will take into account the outcome of the advisory vote under Proposal 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends that shareholders vote, on a non-binding, advisory basis, FOR the resolution to approve executive compensation as described in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5 NON-BINDING, ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF SHAREHOLDERS VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the U.S. Dodd-Frank Act of 2010, we are seeking a non-binding, advisory vote as to the frequency with which shareholders would have an opportunity to provide an advisory vote to approve the executive compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders have the option of selecting a frequency of one, two or three years, or abstaining.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we will continue to monitor developments in this area, our Board believes that an advisory vote to approve executive compensation every year is appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This will enable our shareholders to vote, on an advisory basis, to approve the most recent executive compensation information that is presented in our proxy statement, leading to a more meaningful and coherent communication between us and our shareholders on the executive compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the factors discussed, our Board recommends that future advisory votes to approve executive compensation occur every year until the next advisory vote on the frequency of advisory votes to approve executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are not being asked to approve or disapprove our Boards recommendation, but rather to indicate their choice among the following frequency options: one year, two years or three years, or to abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is advisory, and therefore not binding on us, the Compensation Committee or our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends that shareholders select every ONE year as the frequency of future advisory votes to approve xecutive compensation as described in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hock E. Tan has served as our President, Chief Executive Officer and a director since March 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From September 2005 to January 2008, he served as chairman of the board of directors of IDT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to becoming chairman of IDT, Mr. Tan was the President and Chief Executive Officer of ICS, from June 1999 to September 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to ICS, Mr. Tan was Vice President of Finance with Commodore International, Ltd. from 1992 to 1994, and previously held senior management positions with PepsiCo, Inc. and General Motors Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Tan served as managing director of Pacven Investment, Ltd., a venture capital fund in Singapore from 1988 to 1992, and served as managing director for Hume Industries Ltd. in Malaysia from 1983 to 1988.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas H. Krause, Jr. has served as our Vice President and Chief Financial Officer since October 2016, and served as our acting Chief Financial Officer and principal financial officer from March 2016 to October 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Krause also served as our Vice President, Corporate Development from January 2012 to October 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining us, he was an independent management consultant representing several public and private technology companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Krause previously served as Vice President of Business Development at Techwell, Inc., a mixed-signal fabless semiconductor company, and held various roles with Technology Crossover Ventures and Robertson Stephens.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Charles B. Kawwas, Ph.D. has served as our Senior Vice President and Chief Sales Officer since June 2015 and served as our Senior Vice President, Worldwide Sales from May 2014 to June 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Kawwas served as Senior Vice President of Sales for LSI Corporation (LSI) from 2010 to May 2014, when we acquired LSI, having joined LSI in 2007 as Vice President of Marketing through its acquisition of Agere Systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Agere Systems in 2005, he served as the leader of product line management for optical Ethernet and multiservice edge portfolio at Nortel Networks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Henry Samueli, Ph.D. has served as our Chief Technical Officer and a director since February 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was a co-founder of BRCM and served as its Chief Technical Officer from its inception in 1991 to May 2008 and from December 2009 to January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Samueli also served as BRCMs Vice President of Research and Development from 1991 to May 2003 and as a technology advisor from May 2008 to December 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Samueli has also been a Professor in the Electrical Engineering Department at the University of California, Los Angeles since 1985 (on leave of absence since 1995) and a Distinguished Adjunct Professor in the Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Department of the University of California, Irvine since 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to BRCM, Dr. Samueli was the Chief Scientist and one of the founders of PairGain Technologies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1980 until 1985, he was employed in various engineering management positions in the Electronics and Technology Division of TRW, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Samueli is a Fellow of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences, and a Member of the National Academy of Engineering.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following Compensation Discussion & Analysis (the CD&A) describes the philosophy, objectives and structure of our Fiscal Year 2016 executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This CD&A is intended to be read in conjunction with the tables and other information beginning on page 49, which provide further historical compensation information for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executed officers for Fiscal Year 2016 were Hock E. Tan, President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Thomas H. Krause, Jr., Vice President and Chief Financial Officer (CFO), Charlie B. Kawwas, Ph.D., Senior Vice President and Chief Sales Officer, Henry Samueli, Ph.D., Chief Technical Officer, and Bryan T. Ingram, Senior Vice President and General Manager, Wireless Semiconductor Division, as well as our former CFO, Anthony E. Maslowski (the NEOs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Samueli became an executive officer on February 1, 2016, upon the closing of the acquisition of BRCM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Maslowski went on an indefinite leave of absence for medical reasons on March 24, 2016, at which time Mr. Krause was appointed as acting CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective October 14, 2016, Mr. Maslowskis employment with us ended due to continuing uncertainty regarding his health, and Mr. Krause was appointed as CFO effective as of October 17, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I. Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Fiscal Year 2016 performance was strong on many measures: continued gains in total shareholder return (TSR), increasing evenues, and the successful completion of the strategic acquisition of BRCM, the integration of which is on target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation is structured around the achievement of near-term corporate financial and operational targets (fiscal year metrics) and onger-term business objectives and strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe in rewarding performance; likewise, we believe pay should reflect underperformance, when that occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to closely align our executives interests with those of our shareholders and allocate a significant portion of our executives compensation opportunity to equity-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our CEOs leadership, we have created long-term, sustained value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our overall results in the past fiscal year were impressive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We achieved a number of important strategic objectives, including the acquisition of BRCM, while remaining focused on our core operations and delivering strong operating performance as well as share price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our TSR, based on an investment of $100 in our ordinary shares on the first day of fiscal year 2011, continued to be very strong on both an absolute and relative basis over the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Fiscal Year 2016, our TSR increased 38.5%, surpassing all of the companies in our peer group, as well as the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (the PHLX) and the S&P 500 Index (the S&P Index).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in that same period the PHLX increased by 22.5%, and the S&P Index rose only 1.1% (see chart below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the last five fiscal years, our cumulative TSR has increased by 40.8% annually, and significantly outperformed these indices (see chart below)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our revenue continued to show strong growth as well, reaching $13.2 billion in Fiscal Year 2016 (see graphic below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GAAP operating income increased $2,041 million or 125% over Fiscal Year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-GAAP operating income increased $2,394 million or 81.8% over Fiscal Year 2015, primarily due to the acquisition of BRCM on February 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see page 39 for a reconciliation of Non-GAAP operating income to GAAP operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generated $2,688 million in free cash flow (cash flow from operations of $3,411 million less capital expenditures of $723 million), a 56% increase over Fiscal Year 2015, and ended Fiscal Year 2016 with $3,097 million in cash and cash equivalents, a 70% increase over Fiscal Year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We completed our acquisition of BRCM on February 1, 2016, creating a global, diversified leader in wired and wireless communication semiconductors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to focus the scope of our business, divesting substantially all of the non-core BRCM businesses held for sale
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered on projected synergies across the combined business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are on target to complete the integration of BRCM into our infrastructure as planned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Incentives Reflected Positive 2016 Company Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts under the Fiscal Year 2016 Annual Performance Bonus Plan (the APB Plan), our annual cash incentive bonus program, are tied to pre-established financial and division or function erformance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-GAAP revenue exceeded target but was below the maximum plan performance metric, and non-GAAP operating income as a percentage of non-GAAP revenue for the year exceeded the maximum plan performance metric, which together resulted in 132% attainment of the corporate performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The APB Plan metrics are designed to be challenging to achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The achievement of the divisional or functional performance targets were mixed, with some targets not being achieved and others being met or exceeded, which is due in part to differing business conditions across our various businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the individual performance of each of the NEOs, NEOs were awarded an individual performance multiplier ranging from 100% to 150%, including 150% for Mr. Tan, our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These achievements resulted in attainment levels ranging between 66% and 131% of target for the NEOs under our APB Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount paid to our NEOs under our APB Plan decreased to $4.2 million in Fiscal Year 2016 from $6.0 million in Fiscal Year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally Modest Increases to Base Salaries and No Changes to Target Bonus Opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee or our Board, as applicable, approved generally modest increases to cash compensation levels for our NEOs (the sum of base salary and target annual incentive bonus payouts) in Fiscal Year 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Kawwas and Mr. Ingrams salaries were increased by 3%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Krauses salary was increased 10% to reflect his increased responsibilities as acting CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Samuelis salary, which, due to his position
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as a co-founder of BRCM, was historically set at a nominal level, was increased from $37,440 to $100,000, to eliminate the need to annually increase his base salary to meet various minimum wage requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, our CEO, Mr. Tan, received a base salary increase of 13.6% to compensate him for running a significantly larger organization following the BRCM acquisition and to position his base salary closer to the median of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each case, salary increase decisions for our NEOs were based, in part, on a review of competitive market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target annual performance cash bonus opportunities for Fiscal Year 2016 under the APB Plan were set at the same levels as the prior year for all of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity as a Key Component of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Equity Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During Fiscal Year 2016, Mr. Tan received a 100% performance-based restricted stock unit (PRSU) award, pursuant to which he is eligible to earn up to a maximum of 240,000 ordinary shares based on our relative TSR performance as compared to the S&P Index as well as absolute growth in our share price (the 2016 Grant).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No shares will be earned if our TSR over the three year performance period is below the 25th percentile of the S&P Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to earn the maximum number of shares, our TSR over this three-year period will need to be at or above the 90th percentile of the S&P Index and we must achieve a share price growth of at least 130%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When designing this award, our Board took into account shareholder feedback received in 2013, when we last granted our CEO an equity award, and currently plans to grant Mr. Tan similarly structured performance-based equity awards on an annual basis going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Equity Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal Year 2016, we continued our policy of annually granting our other executives an equal mix of PRSU and service-based restricted stock unit (RSU) awards, in line with prevailing market and industry practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To more closely align our executives interests with those of our shareholders, the performance criteria for the PRSUs were based on sustained increases in our share price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance criteria for these awards will be met only if, and at such time as, the average of the closing prices of our ordinary shares over a 20 consecutive trading day period is equal to or greater than 120% of the closing share price on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Takeaways
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made substantial financial, operational and strategic achievements in Fiscal Year 2016, delivering significant shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and our Board remain committed to ensuring that our executives are focused and incentivized to enhance the long-term sustainable shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our pay program is strongly tied to enhancing shareholder value and increasing our TSR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have successfully increased our TSR since our initial public offering in 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees actions reflect shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and select members of management have conducted substantial shareholder outreach activities over the last several years, as we believe listening to our shareholders is an important factor in designing an effective executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, we communicated with shareholders beneficially owning approximately 45% of our then outstanding ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our CEOs equity grant in 2013, the Compensation Committee solicited shareholder feedback and took that feedback into consideration when designing the 2016 Grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the Compensation Committee designed the 2016 Grant to include a relative TSR performance metric, in addition to an absolute metric to further align management and shareholder interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further align our pay program with shareholder interests and market best practices, beginning June 2016, our Board has decided that future equity awards for our CEO will be granted every year, rather than every few years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has managed executive turnover responsibly, when it occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, we transitioned our CFO position when Mr. Maslowskis employment with our Company ended due to continuing uncertainty regarding his health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance arrangements for our former CFO, Mr. Maslowski, were consistent with the terms of his existing severance agreement and our Policy on Acceleration of Executive Staff Equity Awards in the Event of Death or Disability (the Death and Disability Policy).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: - When Mr. Krause was promoted to the CFO role in October 2016, the Compensation Committee considered the significant increase in his responsibilities in determining his compensation in that role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Krauses base salary was increased to bring him closer to the market median for that position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His bonus target and equity compensation was also reviewed for, and is consistent with, internal parity with our other senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview of Our Pay Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that a significant portion of our executives total compensation should be dependent upon ur performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is designed to reward executives for producing sustainable growth in share value onsistent with our strategic plan, to attract and retain top talent, and to align our executives interests with the interests of our hareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual, direct compensation consists of three main components:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary    Individual salaries are based on an executives responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salaries are set to be competitive with market and industry norms, and to reflect individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-Term Incentives (STI)    The APB Plan is intended to reward the achievement of annual corporate and divisional or functional goals, as well as the individual contributions and performance of each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal Year 2016, our corporate performance measures were non-GAAP revenue and non-GAAP operating income as a percentage of non-GAAP revenue (excluding the expense related to the APB Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives (LTI)    Equity awards, in the form of service-based RSUs and PRSUs, are granted to incentivize our executives to grow long-term sustainable shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, these serve as retention tools for our key executives, and are intended to reflect the value we place on their contribution to our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEOs 2016 Grant was 100% performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charts below show a comparison of the percentage breakdown of target total direct compensation for Fiscal Year 2016 for our CEO compared to certain of our other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This consists of base salary for Fiscal Year 2016, target STI, and grant date fair value of equity awards granted to the executives during the fiscal year, referred to in the chart as LTI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Practices We Do Not Employ
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive plan designs that encourage excessive risk taking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO compensation reviewed by Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last several years we have conducted substantial shareholder outreach efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal Year 2016, we contacted shareholders beneficially owning over 45% of our then outstanding ordinary shares to discuss our compensation philosophy, structure and recent Compensation Committee decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Topics that were discussed included:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our Boards approach to setting CEO long-term compensation, including shifting from a periodic to an annual equity gran process;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the logic in choosing our incentive compensation performance measures and related target levels; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: how our program design has provided incentives to Mr. Tan and our other executives for significantly increasing the size and diversity of our Company through recent acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our shareholders indicated that they were supportive of our recent compensation decisions and program design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The input received from our shareholders was reported to the Compensation Committee and to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frequency of Say-on-Pay Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders, a majority of voting shareholders supported holding a say-on-pay proposal once every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2017 AGM, in addition to the non-binding advisory vote to approve executive compensation of our NEOs sought in Proposal 4, Proposal 5 seeks shareholder approval of the frequency of such vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is recommending annual say-on-pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Not only do we recognize that this has become market best practice, we also believe that this is in the best interest of shareholders, as it facilitates an open and ongoing dialogue between us and our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to achieve the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attract qualified, experienced and talented executives, in a highly competitive market;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: motivate and reward these executives whose skills, knowledge and performance are critical to our on-going success;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: encourage our executives to focus on the achievement of corporate and financial performance goals by aligning their APB Plan payment to the achievement of both corporate and divisional or functional goals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: retain our executives and align their interests with those of our shareholders by linking a significant portion of each executives compensation to returns realizable by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of the target total direct compensation opportunity of our executives is typically in the form of annual equity awards, at least half of which is subject to the attainment of pre-established performance-based objectives, and the rest of which vest based on service over four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards are a long-term retention tool for key executives intended to reflect the value we place on their contributions to our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When granting equity awards or, in the case of our CEO when recommending an equity award to our Board, the Compensation Committee considers each executives level of experience and expertise and overall value to us, as well as how much vested and unvested equity he or she then holds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has adopted a compensation philosophy that is intended to keep our executives target total cash compensation (base salary plus target APB Plan payouts) competitive with that of compensation for similarly situated executives at other companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) in our compensation peer group and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) included in the market salary surveys it reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, where the Compensation Committee believes that the positions in the market match our internal roles, we view target total cash compensation as competitive when it falls within the 25th to 75th percentiles of the competitive market, dependent on the area
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of responsibility relative to product development, sales or support functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that positioning target total cash compensation within this range of the market provides us a competitive position for attracting and retaining executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee bases its compensation decisions on the needs of our Company and an executives level of expertise, experience and marketability and will make exceptions to the above philosophy when it determines it is necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, target total cash compensation for an executive may be outside of the reference range.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Determination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee devotes significant time throughout the year to our executive compensation program to ensure that it aligns executive pay with corporate performance and incentivizes executives to pursue corporate strategic and financial goals that will create sustainable, long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves compensation for all our executive officers, except the compensation of our CEO which is reviewed and approved by the non-employee directors on our Board, following recommendations from the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Executive Compensation Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to market compensation data, the Compensation Committee considers the following information for each executive when determining his or her compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: current base salary, APB Plan target payouts, the accumulated value of unvested outstanding equity awards and other benefits; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the CEOs recommendation with respect to executives other than himself, the executives performance and the executives importance to the organization, among other things.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information helps the Compensation Committee to understand the total compensation being delivered to executives and the long-term retentive elements in place for our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal Pay Parity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we do not maintain a formal policy regarding internal pay parity, it may be considered by the Compensation Committee as a factor when determining compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO is compensated at a higher level than other executives because he has a significantly higher level of responsibility, accountability and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Tan also receives more of his target total direct compensation in the form of long-term, performance- based incentive compensation, as compared to the compensation of the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given Mr. Tans responsibility for our overall performance, our Board believes that compensating him at a higher level than our other executives and weighting his total compensation more heavily toward long-term, performance-based, incentive compensation is consistent with market practice, appropriately reflects his contributions and directly aligns his incentives with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our Board has overall responsibility for risk oversight, each of the committees regularly assesses risk in connection with executing their responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and discusses those risks that relate to our compensation policies and practices and it does not believe that our compensation policies encourage excessive or inappropriate risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal Year 2016, Compensia, Inc. (Compensia) provided consulting services to the Compensation Committee, including the preparation of an assessment of executive compensation based on market compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee relied on Compensia for periodic updates on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: regulatory developments and market trends related to executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensia does not provide any other services to our Company other than advising the Compensation Committee on compensation-related matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has assessed the independence of Compensia pursuant to the six independence factors set forth n the SEC and Nasdaq rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has concluded that Compensia is independent, as Compensias work for the Compensation Committee does not raise any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IV.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Competitive Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee works with Compensia to create a meaningful compensation peer group for purposes of understanding competitive market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This peer group is evaluated annually in September for its appropriateness for comparative purposes only; the Compensation Committee does not benchmark any pay components, or total pay, to a specific percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we view compensation as competitive when it generally falls within the 25th to 75th percentile range relative to our compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of relevant competitive data, the Compensation Committee reviews industry-based market compensation survey data as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation peer group approved by the Compensation Committee for Fiscal Year 2016 appears below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Fiscal Year 2017, the peer group remains largely unchanged, with the exceptions of removing SanDisk Corporation, which was acquired by Western Digital Corporation, and EMC Corporation, which was acquired by Dell Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following selection criteria were considered when developing our compensation peer group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues: comparability across annual revenue, generally 0.5 to 2.0 times that of Broadcom;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market capitalization: market capitalizations that generally fall between 0.3 to 3.0 times that of Broadcom; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Industry: companies in semiconductor-related and other technology-focused industries having a similar scale.

sentences.text: V. Elements of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal components of our executive compensation program are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentive program;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity incentive compensation, including performance-based awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance and change-in-control benefits; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited perquisites and other personal benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that a competitive base salary is an important element of our compensation program designed to attract, engage and retain key executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries provide fixed, baseline compensation and are set at levels intended to reflect an executives level and scope of responsibility, to be within a competitive range for similar positions at the companies in our peer group or in the market salary surveys, where applicable, and internal pay parity between executives, where applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The base salaries of all our executives are reviewed annually by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO makes recommendations to the Compensation Committee with respect to base salary adjustments for each executive (other than himself).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and considers many factors in determining annual adjustments to an executives base salary, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: economic and business conditions and outlook;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individual performance throughout the prior fiscal year, including senior leadership ability and fiscal responsibility;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the actual pay rate of our executives as compared to market pay rates from the market data;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: internal pay equity, where applicable; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the other factors described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and considers many factors in determining individual performance for the purposes of adjusting base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These factors include such measures as division or function performance against budget, achievement of divisional or functional goals, new product introductions and corporate strategy implementation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On May 31, 2016, the Compensation Committee approved the following increases in base salaries for our NEOs to be effective July 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, Dr. Samueli received a nominal base salary designed to satisfy various minimum wage requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in order to avoid having to minimally increase Dr. Samuelis base salary each year to comply with such requirements, his base salary was increased to $100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Tans base salary increase followed by a review of his base salary as compared to the peer group, which reflects our increased size following the BRCM acquisition and moves his base salary closer to the peer group median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with Mr. Krauses appointment as CFO in October 2016, the Compensation Committee approved a further increase in Mr. Krauses base salary from $371,158 to $400,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Maslowski went on a leave of absence for health reasons effective March 24, 2016, and therefore was not considered for a base salary increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that a significant portion of our executives target total direct compensation should be dependent upon performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have the APB Plan for all of our executives and a separate, similarly structured, plan for all other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The APB Plan is designed to encourage and motivate our CEO to achieve overall corporate goals and our other executives to achieve both corporate and divisional or functional goals, to drive positive contribution to our growth and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO has a specified target bonus amount under the APB Plan expressed as a percentage of base salary, other than Dr. Samueli as he does not participate in our APB Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The structure of the APB Plan for Fiscal Year 2016 was substantially the same as for Fiscal Year 2015 and the NEOs bonus target percentages remained the same.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash bonuses under the APB Plan are calculated as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Bonus Targets as a Percentage of Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO    APB Plan Target Bonus (as a % of base salary)   Hock E. Tan    150%   Thomas H. Krause Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 60%(1)   Charlie B. Kawwas, Ph.D.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 75%   Bryan T. Ingram    100%   Anthony E. Maslowski    75%(2)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) In connection with Mr. Krauses appointment as CFO in October 2016, the Compensation Committee increased his target bonus percentage under the APB Plan from 60% of base salary to 75% of base salary, effective for Fiscal Year 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the compensation market data as a point of reference in determining each executives bonus target percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee sets, or in the case of our CEO, recommends to our Board for approval, target bonus percentages based on each executives experience in his or her role with us and the level of responsibility held by each executive, which the Compensation Committee believes directly correlates to his or her ability to influence corporate and operational results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Fiscal Year 2016, if an executives role or function changed during the fiscal year such that the applicable performance metrics were also changed, the executives performance-based bonus under the APB Plan was calculated on a pro-rated basis using the relevant metrics for the periods served in each capacity during the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in Fiscal Year 2017, for executives who change roles or functions during the year, their performance for the entire fiscal year will be measured based on the metrics applicable to the role or function they are performing at the end of the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonuses under the APB Plan are payable to the NEOs in cash, with the exception of our CEO in certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event our Board assigns our CEO an individual performance multiplier (discussed in more detail below) greater than 100%, it may elect to pay the difference between the dollar amount of our CEOs actual bonus amount and the dollar amount of his bonus calculated using a performance factor of 100% in the form of an equity award under the 2009 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The type and terms of any such equity award would be determined by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that this feature allows it to further incentivize our CEO to focus on our mid- to long- term performance and to further provide for value creation for our shareholders, to more closely align the CEOs interests with those of shareholders generally, as well as to provide additional retention incentive to the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The corporate performance measures for Fiscal Year 2016 were
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) non-GAAP revenue, which includes the effect of acquisition- related purchase accounting adjustments relating to licensing revenue and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) non-GAAP operating income as a percentage of non-GAAP revenue, adjusted to exclude the effects of provisions or accruals for anticipated payouts under the APB Plan, which would otherwise have the effect of reducing non-GAAP operating income margin, referred to as non-GAAP operating margin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures for Fiscal Year 2016 were established including three quarters of projected contributions from the acquired BRCM businesses, and each goal carried an equal weighting of 50% of the corporate performance component.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target attainment level for non-GAAP revenue for Fiscal Year 2016 was set at $13,227 million, and the maximum attainment level was set at $13,491 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target attainment level for non-GAAP operating
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: margin for Fiscal Year 2016 was set at 39.9%, and the maximum attainment level was set at 42%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These metrics were established by the Compensation Committee, based on the recommendation of management, and approved by our Board, and were designed to be difficult to attain and to require substantial effort by management to achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final payouts under the APB Plan include the effect of each NEOs applicable individual performance multiplier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each individual NEOs performance multiplier (other than the CEOs) is approved by the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee based in part on the recommendations of our CEO for each executive (other than for himself) and by our Board in the case of our CEO with input from the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining individual performance, the Compensation Committee also considers the requirements of the executives position, including the achievement of the divisional or functional goals, fiscal responsibility as determined by the Compensation Committee with input from our CEO, the executives senior leadership capability, and how each of these factors impacts the overall performance of the executives division or function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on their respective levels of performance and individual contribution, the Compensation Committee, or our Board in the case of our CEO, assigns each executive an individual performance multiplier of between 50% and 150%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives, who consistently meet or exceed the requirements of the position, as determined by the Compensation Committee, receive a bonus multiplier of between 100% and 150%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives who meet some, but not all, of the requirements of the position or for whom the Compensation Committee believes that improvement is needed will receive a bonus multiplier of between 50% and less than 100%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, or our Board in the case of our CEO, may adjust our executives individual performance multiplier upwards or downwards in its sole discretion, based on any criteria it determines appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Fiscal Year 2016, our Board, based upon the recommendations of the Compensation Committee, determined that Mr. Tan should receive a performance multiplier of 150% in recognition of his successful acquisition strategy and strategic decision making, the successful progression of the integration of BRCM, cash generation and shareholder value creation during Fiscal Year 2016, in addition to strong revenue growth and non-GAAP operating profitability for the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Tans bonus payout amount under the APB Plan for Fiscal Year 2016 was $2,970,774.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our Board determined that it would pay $1,980,516 of that amount, which represents his payout based on a performance multiplier of 100%, in cash, and deliver the remaining $990,258 in the form of a time-based vesting RSU award of 6,010 RSUs granted effective December 15, 2016 (with the number of RSUs calculated based on a closing share price of $164.76 on December 6, 2016, the day prior to the date on which the award was approved by our Board), which vests 25% annually subject to continued service on each vesting date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee with input from our CEO (other than with respect to himself), determined that each of our other NEOs should receive an individual performance multiplier of between 100% and 150% based on these individuals respective contributions towards these achievements and their respective divisional or functional achievements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary Bonuses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee may supplement the performance-based cash incentive plan awards earned by our NEOs with discretionary bonuses that are awarded based on our CEOs recommendations, other than with respect to himself, and the Compensation Committees assessment of individual contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Krause received a $200,000 discretionary cash bonus due to his service as acting CFO for a portion of the year and his contributions to the integration of BRCM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity awards provide a long-term retention tool for our executives and are intended to reflect the value we place on their contribution to our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The philosophy behind equity awards is to provide the executive with a strong incentive to remain with, and build value in, us over an extended period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that a combination of service-based and performance-based equity awards balances promoting long-term retention of executives by providing an element of certainty of value rom service-based awards, with motivating the executive to improve performance and maximize our share price, thereby more closely aligning executives interests with those of our shareholders generally, through the performance-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves all equity awards granted to our executive officers, other than our CEO whose equity awards are approved by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making initial and subsequent equity awards, the Compensation Committee takes into consideration the executives position and level, past equity awards, other compensation and the value the executive brings to our Company based on his or her technical experience,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expertise and leadership capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also reviews annually the amount of vested and unvested equity that an executive holds and the fair market value of the unvested equity compared to the executives base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal Year 2016 Mix of Equity Incentive Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant equity awards to our executives annually, typically in March of each year, and which are generally awarded under the 2009 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with its philosophy behind equity awards and the considerations in Fiscal Year 2016, the Compensation Committee granted equity awards to our executives (other than the CEO) that were 50% service-based and 50% performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The service-based awards vest over four years, with 25% vesting annually, subject to the executives continued service on the vesting dates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based awards are also scheduled to vest over four-years at the rate of 25% annually, but are also subject to the satisfaction of the applicable share-price performance criteria within that four-year period, discussed in more detail below under Fiscal Year 2016 Performance-Based Restricted Share Units, and subject to the executives continued service on the vesting dates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
