sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: basis for our excess inventory charge and the written-down value of the inventory becomes its new cost basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-retirement benefit plan assets and liabilities are estimates of benefits that we expect to pay to eligible retirees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider various factors in determining the value of our post-retirement net assets, including the number of employees that we expect to receive benefits and other actuarial assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For defined benefit pension plans, we consider various factors in determining our respective pension liabilities and net periodic benefit costs, including the number of employees that we expect to receive benefits, their salary levels and years of service, the expected return on plan assets, the discount rate, the timing of the payment of benefits, and other actuarial assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the actual results and events of the pension plans differ from our current assumptions, the benefit obligations may be over- or under-valued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key benefit plan assumptions are the discount rate and the expected rate of return on plan assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assumptions discussed below are for the U.S. retirement benefit plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the non-U.S. plans, we chose assumptions specific to each country.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The U.S. discount rates are based on the results of matching expected plan benefit payments with cash flows from a hypothetical yield curve constructed with high-quality corporate bond yields.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We base the salary increase assumptions on historical experience and future expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In developing the expected rate of return, we consider long-term compound annualized returns based on historical market data, historical and expected returns on the various categories of plan assets, and the target investment portfolio allocation among debt, equity securities and other investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivative instruments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are subject to foreign currency risks for transactions denominated in foreign currencies, primarily the Singapore Dollar, Malaysian Ringgit, Euro, Japanese Yen and Indian Rupee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we enter into foreign exchange forward contracts to manage financial exposures resulting from the changes in the exchange rates of these foreign currencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These contracts are designated at inception as hedges of the related foreign currency exposures, which include committed and forecasted revenue and expense transactions that are denominated in currencies other than the functional currency of the subsidiary which has the exposure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exclude time value from the measurement of effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To achieve hedge accounting, contracts must reduce the foreign currency exchange rate risk otherwise inherent in the amount and duration of the hedged exposures and comply with established risk management policies; our hedging contracts generally mature within three months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not use derivative financial instruments for speculative or trading purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BROADCOM LIMITED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the financial year ended October 30, 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivative instruments (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We designate our forward contracts as either cash flow or fair value hedges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All derivatives are recognized on the consolidated balance sheets at their fair values based on Level 2 inputs as defined in the fair value hierarchy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accounting for gains and losses resulting from changes in fair value depends on the use of the derivative and whether it is designated and qualifies for hedge accounting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For derivative instruments that are designated and qualify as fair value hedges, changes in value of the instruments are recognized in income in the current period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such hedges are recognized in net income (loss) and are offset by the changes in fair value of the underlying assets or liabilities being hedged.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For derivative instruments that are designated and qualify as cash flow hedges, changes in the value of the effective portion of the derivative instrument are recognized in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss), a component of shareholders equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts are then reclassified and recognized in net income (loss) when either the forecasted transaction occurs or it becomes probable the forecasted transaction will not occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in the fair value of the ineffective portion of derivative instruments are recognized in net income (loss) in the current period, which have not been material to date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in the value of derivative instruments not designated as hedges are recognized in other income, net, in our consolidated statements of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Property, Plant and Equipment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Property, plant and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated depreciation and amortization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additions, improvements and major renewals are capitalized, and maintenance, repairs and minor renewals are expensed as incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assets are held in construction in progress until placed in service, upon which date, we begin to depreciate these assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When assets are retired or disposed of, the assets and related accumulated depreciation and amortization are removed from our property, plant and equipment balances and the resulting gain or loss is reflected in the consolidated statements of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Buildings and leasehold improvements are generally depreciated over 15 to 40 years, or over the lease period, whichever is shorter, and machinery and equipment are generally depreciated over three to ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the straight-line method of depreciation for all property, plant and equipment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fair value measurement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fair value is defined as the price that would be received upon sale of an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A three level hierarchy is applied to prioritize the inputs to valuation techniques used to measure fair value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The hierarchy gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1 measurements) and the lowest priority to unobservable inputs (Level 3 measurements).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BROADCOM LIMITED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the financial year ended October 30, 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fair value measurement (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three levels of the fair value hierarchy under the guidance for fair value measurements are described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Level 1  Level 1 inputs are quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities that the reporting entity has the ability to access at the measurement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Level 1 assets include cash equivalents, bankers acceptances, trading securities investments and investment funds (i.e., deferred compensation plan assets).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We measure trading securities investments and investment funds at quoted market prices as they are traded in an active market with sufficient volume and frequency of transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Level 2  Level 2 inputs are inputs other than quoted prices included within Level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the asset or liability has a specified contractual term, a Level 2 input must be observable for substantially the full term of the asset or liability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Level 3  Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs for the asset or liability in which there is little, if any, market activity for the asset or liability at the measurement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Level 3 assets and liabilities include cost method investments, goodwill, amortizable intangible assets, and property, plant and equipment, which are measured at fair value using a discounted cash flow approach when they are impaired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quantitative information for Level 3 assets and liabilities reviewed at each reporting period includes indicators of significant deterioration in the earnings performance, credit rating, asset quality, business prospects of the investee, and financial indicators of the investees ability to continue as a going concern.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business combinations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We account for business combinations under the acquisition method of accounting, which requires us to recognize separately from goodwill the assets acquired and the liabilities assumed at their acquisition date fair values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we use our best estimates and assumptions to accurately value assets acquired and liabilities assumed at the acquisition date as well as contingent consideration, where applicable, our estimates are inherently uncertain and subject to refinement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, during the measurement period, which may be up to one year from the acquisition date, we record adjustments to the assets acquired and liabilities assumed with the corresponding offset to goodwill.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the conclusion of the measurement period or final determination of the values of assets acquired or liabilities assumed, whichever comes first, any subsequent adjustments are recognized in our consolidated statements of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BROADCOM LIMITED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

sentences.text: 2. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business combinations (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting for business combinations requires our management to make significant estimates and assumptions, especially at the acquisition date including our estimates for intangible assets, contractual obligations assumed, restructuring liabilities, pre-acquisition contingencies, and contingent consideration, where applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we believe the assumptions and estimates we have made in the past have been reasonable and appropriate, they are based, in part, on historical experience and information obtained from the management of the acquired companies and are inherently uncertain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Critical estimates in valuing certain of the intangible assets we have acquired include future expected cash flows from product sales, customer contracts and acquired technologies, expected costs to develop in-process research and development into commercially viable products, and estimated cash flows from the projects when completed and discount rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unanticipated events and circumstances may occur that may affect the accuracy or validity of such assumptions, estimates or actual results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goodwill
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goodwill represents the excess of purchase price and related costs over the value assigned to the net tangible and identifiable intangible assets of businesses acquired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goodwill is not amortized but is reviewed annually (or more frequently if impairment indicators arise) for impairment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To review for impairment we first assess qualitative factors to determine whether events or circumstances lead to a determination that it is more likely than not that the fair value of any of our reporting units is less than its carrying amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our qualitative assessment of the recoverability of goodwill, whether performed annually or based on specific events or circumstances, considers various macroeconomic, industry-specific and company-specific factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those factors include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) severe adverse industry or economic trends;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) significant company-specific actions, including exiting an activity in conjunction with restructuring of operations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) current, historical or projected deterioration of our financial performance; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a sustained decrease in our market capitalization below our net book value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After assessing the totality of events and circumstances, if we determine that it is not more likely than not that the fair value of any of our reporting units is less than its carrying amount, no further assessment is performed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we determine that it is more likely than not that the fair value of any of our reporting units is less than its carrying amount, we calculate the fair value of that reporting unit and compare the fair value to the reporting units net book value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the fair value of the reporting unit is greater than its net book value, there is no impairment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise, we calculate the implied fair value of goodwill by deducting the fair value of all tangible and intangible assets, excluding goodwill, of the reporting unit from the fair value of the reporting unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The implied fair value of goodwill is compared to the carrying value of goodwill.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the implied fair value of goodwill is less than the carrying value of goodwill, an impairment loss is recognized equal to the difference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Long-lived assets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purchased finite-lived intangible assets are carried at cost less accumulated amortization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amortization is recognized over the periods during which the intangible assets are expected to contribute to our cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purchased in-process research and development, or IPR&D, projects are capitalized at fair value as an indefinite lived intangible asset and assessed for impairment thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon completion of each underlying project, IPR&D assets are reclassified as an amortizable purchased intangible asset and amortized over their estimated useful lives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an IPR&D project is abandoned, we recognize the carrying value of the related intangible asset in our consolidated statements of operations in the period it is abandoned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a quarterly basis, we monitor factors and changes in circumstances that could indicate carrying amounts of long-lived assets, including purchased intangible assets, and property, plant and equipment, may not be recoverable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors we consider important which could trigger an impairment review include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) significant under-performance relative to historical or projected future operating results,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) significant changes in the manner of our use of the acquired assets or the strategy for our overall business, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) significant negative industry or economic trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An impairment loss must be measured if the sum of the expected future cash flows (undiscounted and before interest) from the use and eventual disposition of the asset (or asset group) is less than the net book value of the asset (or asset group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the impairment loss will generally be measured as the difference between the net book value of the asset (or asset group) and the estimated fair value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Warranty
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accrue for the estimated costs of product warranties at the time revenue is recognized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Product warranty costs are estimated based upon our historical experience and specific identification of the products requirements, which may fluctuate based on product mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we accrue for warranty costs associated with occasional or unanticipated product quality issues if a loss is probable and can be reasonably estimated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue Recognition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize revenue related to sales of our products, net of trade discounts and allowances, provided that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) delivery has occurred and title and risk of loss have transferred,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the price is fixed or determinable and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) collectibility is reasonably assured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivery is considered to have occurred when title and risk of loss have transferred to the customer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider the price to be determinable when the price is not subject to refund or adjustments or when any such adjustments can be estimated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We evaluate the creditworthiness of our customers to determine that appropriate credit limits are established prior to the acceptance of an order.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue, including sales to resellers and distributors, is reduced for estimated returns and distributor allowances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize revenue from sales of our products to distributors upon delivery of product to the distributors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An allowance for distributor credits covering price adjustments is made
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue Recognition (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: based on our estimate of historical experience rates as well as considering economic conditions and contractual terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To date, actual distributor claims activity has been materially consistent with the provisions we have made based on our historical estimates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also record reductions of revenue for rebates, in the same period that the related revenue is recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accrue 100% of potential rebates at the time of sale and do not apply a breakage factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reverse the accrual of unclaimed rebate amounts as specific rebate programs contractually end and when we believe unclaimed rebates are no longer subject to payment and will not be paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, the reversal of unclaimed rebates may have a positive impact on our net revenue and results of operations in subsequent periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We enter into development agreements with some of our customers and recognize revenue from these agreements upon completion and acceptance by the customer of contract deliverables or as services are provided, depending on the terms of the arrangement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue is deferred for any amounts billed or received prior to completion or delivery of services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we retain the intellectual property generated from these development agreements, costs related to these arrangements are included in research and development expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize revenue from the sales and licensing of our intellectual property when the following fundamental criteria are met:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) delivery has occurred,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the sales price is fixed or determinable, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) collection of resulting receivables is reasonably assured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue from upfront payments for the licensing of our patents is recognized when the arrangement is mutually signed, if there is no future delivery or future performance obligation and all other criteria are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue from guaranteed royalty streams are recognized when paid, or collection is reasonably assured and all other criteria are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When patent licensing arrangements include royalties for future sales of the licensees products using our licensed patented technology, revenue is recognized when the royalty report is received from the licensee, at which time the sales price is determinable, provided that all other criteria have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Research and Development
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Research and development expense consists primarily of personnel costs for our engineers and third parties engaged in the design and development of our products, software and technologies, including salary, bonus and share-based compensation expense, project material costs, services and depreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such costs are charged to research and development expense as they are incurred.

sentences.text: Share-Based Compensation Expense
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize compensation expense for time-based share options and employee share purchase plan rights based on the estimated grant-date fair value method required under the applicable authoritative guidance using the Black-Scholes valuation model with a straight-line amortization method.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize compensation expense for time-based restricted share units, or RSUs, using the straight-line amortization method based on the fair value of RSUs on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fair value of RSUs is the closing market price of Broadcom ordinary shares on the date of grant, reduced by the present value of dividends expected to be paid on Broadcom ordinary shares prior to vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain equity awards granted included both service and market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fair value of market-based awards was estimated on the date of grant using the Monte Carlo simulation technique.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assumptions utilized in the Monte Carlo simulation model follow the same methodology as our time-based option awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation expense for market-based awards is amortized based upon a graded vesting method over the service period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the applicable authoritative guidance requires share-based compensation expense to be based on awards that are ultimately expected to vest, estimated share-based compensation expense for such awards has been reduced for estimated forfeitures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in the estimated forfeiture rates can have a significant effect on share-based compensation expense since the effect of adjusting the rate is recognized in the period the forfeiture estimate is changed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize a benefit from share-based compensation in shareholders equity if an incremental tax benefit is realized by following the ordering provisions of the tax law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shipping and Handling Costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our shipping and handling costs charged to customers are included in net revenue and the associated expense is included in cost of products sold in the consolidated statements of operations for all periods presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advertising
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advertising costs are expensed as incurred and included within selling, general and administrative expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advertising costs were not material for financial years 2016 and 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Litigation and settlement cost
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are involved in legal actions and other matters arising in our recent business acquisitions and in the normal course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize an estimated loss contingency when the outcome is probable prior to issuance of the consolidated financial statements and we are able to reasonably estimate the amount or range of any possible loss.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taxes on Income
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We account for income taxes under the asset and liability method, which requires the recognition of deferred tax assets and liabilities for the expected future tax consequences of events that have been included in the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this method, deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the differences between the consolidated financial statements and tax bases of assets and liabilities using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effect of a change in tax rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities is recognized in income in the period that includes the enactment date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize net deferred tax assets to the extent we believe these assets will more likely than not be realized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making such determination, we consider all available positive and negative evidence, including scheduled reversals of deferred tax liabilities, projected future taxable income, tax planning strategies and recent financial operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we determine that we are able to realize our deferred income tax assets in the future in excess of their net carrying values, we adjust the valuation allowance and reduce the provision for income taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise, if we determine that we are not be able to realize all or part of our net deferred tax assets, we increase the provision for income taxes in the period such determination is made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We account for uncertainty in income taxes in accordance with the applicable accounting guidance on income taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance provides that a tax benefit from an uncertain tax position may be recognized when it is more likely than not that the position will be sustained upon examination, including resolutions of any related appeals or litigation processes, based on the technical merits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per Share
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Basic net income (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) attributable to ordinary shares by the weighted- average number of Broadcom ordinary shares outstanding during the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diluted net income (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) attributable to ordinary shares and, if the Partnership REUs are dilutive, net income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interest by the weighted-average number of Broadcom ordinary shares and potentially dilutive share equivalents outstanding during the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diluted shares outstanding include the dilutive effect of in-the-money share options, RSUs and employee share purchase rights under the Amended and Restated Broadcom Limited Employee Share Purchase Plan, or ESPP (together referred to as equity awards) and the 2.0% Convertible Senior Notes due 2021 issued by Avago, or the Convertible Notes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The dilutive effect of equity awards is calculated based on the average share price for each fiscal period, using the treasury stock method.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the treasury stock method, the amount the employee must pay for exercising share options and to purchase shares under the ESPP, the amount of compensation cost for future service that we have not yet recognized, and the amount of tax benefits that would be recognized when equity awards become deductible for income tax purposes are collectively assumed to be used to repurchase ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recently Adopted Accounting Guidance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2015, the Financial Accounting Standards Board, or FASB, issued guidance that simplifies the presentation of deferred tax assets and liabilities in a classified balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance eliminates the requirement to present deferred tax assets and liabilities as current and non-current in a classified balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, all deferred tax assets and liabilities are classified as non-current.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We adopted this guidance during the first quarter of fiscal year 2016 on a prospective basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption resulted in $116 million of net current deferred tax assets being reclassified from other current assets to other long- term assets on our January 31, 2016 condensed consolidated balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2015, the FASB amended the guidance related to the financial statement presentation of debt issuance costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidance requires certain debt issuance costs to be presented on the balance sheet as a direct reduction to the carrying amount of debt, consistent with debt discounts or premiums.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2015, the FASB further clarified that entities are permitted to defer and present debt issuance costs related to line-of-credit arrangements as assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We early-adopted this guidance during the fiscal quarter ended May 1, 2016, and applied its provisions retrospectively, as required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption resulted in $13 million of other current assets and $64 million of other long-term assets being reclassified to long-term debt on our consolidated balance sheet as of November 1, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2015, the FASB amended the guidance related to the fair value hierarchy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance removes the requirement to categorize within the fair value hierarchy all investments for which fair value is measured using the net asset value, or NAV, per share practical expedient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, this guidance eliminates the requirement to make certain disclosures for all investments that are eligible to be measured at fair value using the NAV per share practical expedient, and instead limits the disclosure to those investments for which the entity has elected to measure fair value using the NAV practical expedient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We early adopted this guidance on a retrospective basis in fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption of this authoritative guidance changed the presentation of our disclosures for applicable investments in Note 7.

sentences.text: In October 2016, the FASB issued updated guidance related to the recognition of income tax consequences of an intra-entity transfer of an asset other than inventory.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal year 2018; however, early adoption is permitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption of this guidance will increase our income tax provision for periods in which we perform intra-entity transfers.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal year 2019; however, early adoption is permitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will present our statement of cash flows in accordance with this guidance for transactions occurring subsequent to adoption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal year 2018; however, early adoption is permitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are currently planning to early adopt this guidance in the first quarter of fiscal year 2017 and we are evaluating the impact that this guidance will have on our consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the FASB issued guidance related to the accounting for leases, which among other things, requires a lessee to recognize lease assets and lease liabilities on the balance sheet for operating leases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal year 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new guidance is required to be applied using a modified retrospective approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are currently evaluating the impact that this guidance will have on our consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2015, the FASB issued guidance to determine whether a cloud computing arrangement includes software.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a cloud computing arrangement includes software, the customer should account for the software element of the arrangement consistent with the acquisition of other software licenses.

sentences.text: If a cloud computing arrangement does not include software, the customer should account for the arrangement as a service contract.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acquisition of Broadcom Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Broadcom Merger closed on February 1, 2016, or the Acquisition Date, pursuant to the terms of the Broadcom Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate consideration for the Broadcom Merger, which consisted of both cash and equity consideration, was approximately $28,758 million, net of cash acquired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We funded the cash portion of the Broadcom Merger with the net proceeds from the issuance of the 2016 Term Loans, as defined and discussed in further detail in Note 8 Borrowings, as well as cash on hand of the combined companies.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BRCM was a leader in semiconductor solutions for wired and wireless communications and provided a broad portfolio of highly-integrated system-on-a-chip solutions that seamlessly deliver voice, video, data and multimedia connectivity in the home, office and mobile environments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We acquired BRCM to position us as a global diversified leader in wired and wireless communication semiconductors and to deepen our broad portfolios, and to enable us to better address the evolving needs of customers across the wired and wireless end markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate consideration for the Broadcom Merger, net of cash acquired, consisted of the following (in millions)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Group   Cash for outstanding BRCM common stock        16,798   Fair value of Broadcom ordinary shares issued for outstanding BRCM common stock        15,438   Fair value of Partnership REUs issued for outstanding BRCM common stock        3,140   Fair value of partially vested assumed restricted stock unit awards        182   Cash for vested BRCM equity awards        137   Effective settlement of pre-existing relationships        11     Total purchase consideration        35,706   Less: Cash acquired        6,948     Total purchase consideration, net of cash acquired        28,758
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadcom issued 112 million ordinary shares and the Partnership issued 23 million Partnership REUs, all of which are valued and presented in the above table, to former BRCM shareholders in the Broadcom Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadcom also assumed unvested RSUs originally granted by BRCM and converted them into 6 million of Broadcom RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The portion of the fair value of partially vested assumed RSUs associated with prior service of BRCM employees represented a component of the total consideration, as presented above, and was valued based on Broadcoms ordinary share price as of the Acquisition Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We allocated the purchase price to tangible and intangible assets acquired and liabilities assumed based on their estimated fair values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fair value of identifiable intangible assets acquired was based on estimates and assumptions made by management at the time of acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2016, we made adjustments to certain tax balances, resulting in a $52 million decrease in goodwill.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As additional information becomes available, such as finalization of the estimated fair value of tax related items, we may further revise our preliminary purchase price allocation during the remainder of the measurement period (which will not exceed 12 months from the Acquisition Date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such revisions or changes may be material as we finalize the fair values of the tangible and intangible assets acquired and liabilities assumed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We valued the developed technology using the multi-period excess earnings method under the income approach.

sentences.text: This method reflects the present value of the projected cash flows that are expected to be generated by the developed technology less charges representing the contribution of other assets to those cash flows.

sentences.text: Unaudited Pro Forma Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following unaudited pro forma financial information presents combined results of operations for each of the periods presented, as if BRCM had been acquired as of the beginning of fiscal year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The unaudited pro forma financial information for fiscal years 2016 and 2015 combined the historical results of Avago for the fiscal quarter ended January 31, 2016 and the fiscal year ended November 1, 2015 and the historical results of BRCM for the three months ended December 31, 2015 and the twelve months ended September 30, 2015, representing BRCMs previous reporting periods prior to the Acquisition Date, and the historical results of Broadcom for the fiscal quarters ended May 1, 2016, July 31, 2016 and October 30, 2016.

sentences.text: We completed additional acquisitions in 2016 and 2015 to enhance our competitive positions.

sentences.text: On May 5, 2015, we acquired Emulex Corporation, or Emulex, a leader in network connectivity, monitoring and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We acquired Emulex to broaden our portfolios to better serve the enterprise storage end market.

sentences.text: Pending Acquisition of Brocade Communications Systems, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On November 2, 2016, we entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger, or Brocade Agreement, by and among Broadcom, BRCM, Brocade Communications Systems, Inc., a Delaware corporation, or Brocade, and Bobcat Merger Sub, Inc., a Delaware corporation and a direct wholly owned subsidiary of BRCM, or Merger Sub.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Brocade Agreement provides that, upon the terms and subject to the conditions set forth therein, Merger Sub will merge with and into Brocade, or Brocade Merger, with Brocade as the surviving corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the Brocade Merger, Brocade will become an indirect subsidiary of Broadcom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Brocade Agreement, at the effective time of the Brocade Merger, each issued and outstanding share of Brocade common stock held by Brocade stockholders who perfect their appraisal rights with respect to the Brocade Merger will be converted into the right to receive $12.75 in cash, without interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Brocade Merger is currently valued at $5.5 billion plus $0.4 billion of net debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to finance the transaction with cash on hand from both companies and new debt financing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also assume certain vested (to the extent not in-the-money) and all unvested Brocade stock options, restricted stock units and performance stock units held by continuing employees and service providers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All vested in-the-money Brocade stock options, after giving effect to any acceleration, and all other restricted stock units and performance stock units will be cashed out at the effective time of the Brocade Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brocade has made customary representations, warranties and covenants in the Brocade Agreement, including, without limitation, covenants not to solicit alternative transactions or, subject to certain exceptions, not to enter into discussions concerning, or provide confidential information in connection with, an alternative transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of Broadcom, BRCM and Merger Sub, collectively, the Broadcom Parties, also has made customary representations, warranties and covenants in the Brocade Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consummation of the Brocade Merger is subject to the satisfaction or waiver of customary closing conditions, including adoption of the Brocade Agreement by Brocade stockholders, the expiration or termination of the waiting period under the United States Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act of 1976, as amended, the receipt of regulatory clearance under certain other laws and the absence of certain pending governmental litigation with respect to the transactions contemplated by the Brocade Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Brocade Agreement, Brocade has agreed to cooperate with us to facilitate the sale, disposition or other transfer of its IP Networking business, including its recently acquired Ruckus Wireless business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consummation of the Brocade Merger is not conditioned on the divestiture of Brocades IP Networking business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. Retirement Plans and Post-Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension and Post-Retirement Benefit Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defined Benefit Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The U.S. defined benefit pension plans include a management plan and a represented plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the management plan are provided under either an adjusted career-average-pay program or a cash-balance program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the represented plan are based on a dollar-per-month formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit accruals under the management plan were frozen in 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the adjusted career-average-pay program no longer earn service accruals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the cash-balance program no longer earn service accruals, but continue to earn 4% interest per year on their cash-balance accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no active participants under the represented plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have a non-qualified supplemental pension plan in the United States that principally provides benefits based on compensation in excess of amounts that can be considered under the management plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have pension plans covering certain non-U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Retirement Benefit Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain of our U.S. employees who were age 49 or younger on January 1, 2005 and who meet the retirement eligibility requirements as of their termination dates, may receive post-retirement medical benefits under our retiree medical account program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2014, we amended our U.S. post-retirement medical benefit plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amendment affected active, eligible employees and had no impact on existing retirees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the amendment, employees who were previously eligible for a medical benefit spending account of $40,000 upon retirement received a cash settlement and have ceased to be eligible for post-retirement medical benefits under the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For employees who were previously eligible for a medical benefit spending account of $55,000 upon retirement, we extended the maximum age to use, as retirees, the spending account to pay premiums for medical coverage from 65 to 75.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees who were previously eligible for the traditional retiree medical plan upon retirement are no longer eligible to participate in such a plan and will, instead, only be eligible for an extended $55,000 retiree medical account program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our group life insurance plan offers post-retirement life insurance coverage for certain U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-U.S Retirement Benefit Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the defined benefit plans for certain employees in Taiwan, Thailand, India, Japan, Korea, Israel, United Kingdom, France, Italy and Germany, other eligible employees outside of the United States receive retirement benefits under various defined contribution retirement plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility is generally determined based on the terms of our plans and local statutory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defined Benefit Plan Investment Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan assets of the funded defined benefit pension plans are invested in funds held by third-party fund managers or are deposited into government-managed accounts in which we have no active involvement in and no control over investment strategy, other than establishing broad investment guidelines and parameters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan assets held by third-parties consist primarily of equities, fixed income funds and commingled funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fund managers monitor the funds asset allocation within the guidelines established by our plans investment committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In line with plan investment objectives and consultation with our management, our investment committee set an allocation benchmark among equity, bond and other assets based on the relative weighting of overall non-U.S. market indices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overall investment objectives of the plan are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1) the acquisition of suitable assets of appropriate liquidity which will generate income and capital growth to meet current and future plan benefits,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2) to limit the risk of the assets failing to meet the long-term liabilities of the plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3) to minimize the long-term costs of the plan by maximizing the return on the assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance is regularly evaluated by the investment committee and is based on actual returns achieved by the fund manager relative to its benchmark.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the defined benefit pension plans, the investment strategy for the U.S. plans is to allocate assets in a manner that seeks both to maximize the safety of promised benefits and to minimize the cost of funding those benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We direct the overall portfolio allocation and use a third-party investment consultant that has discretion to structure portfolios and select the investment managers within those
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple investment managers are utilized, including both active and passive management approaches.

sentences.text: The plan assets are diversified across different asset classes and investment styles, and those assets are periodically rebalanced toward asset allocation targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target asset allocation for U.S. plans reflects a risk/return profile that we believe is appropriate relative to the liability structure and return goals for the plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We periodically review the allocation of plan assets relative to alternative allocation models to evaluate the need for adjustments based on forecasted liabilities and plan liquidity needs.

sentences.text: The fixed-income allocation is primarily directed oward long-term core bond investments, with smaller allocations to Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities and high-yield bonds.

sentences.text: Post-Retirement Benefit Plan Investment Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our overall investment strategy for the group life insurance plan is to allocate assets in a manner that seeks to both maximize the safety of promised benefits and minimize the cost of funding those benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target asset allocation for plan assets reflects a risk/return profile that we believe is appropriate relative to the liability structure and return goals for the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We periodically review the allocation of plan assets relative to alternative allocation models to evaluate the need for adjustments based on forecasted liabilities and plan liquidity needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set the overall portfolio allocation and use an investment manager that directs the investment of funds consistent with that allocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investment manager invests the plan assets in index funds that it manages.

sentences.text: 8. Borrowings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Term Loans and Revolving Credit Facility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the completion of the Broadcom Merger, on February 1, 2016, three Broadcom subsidiaries, together with a group of lenders, including Bank of America, N.A., as the administrative agent and collateral agent, entered into a collateralized credit agreement, or the 2016 Credit Agreement, which originally provided for a Term A loan facility in the aggregate principal amount of $4,400 million, or the Term A Loan, a Term B-1 dollar loan facility in the aggregate principal amount of $9,750 million, or the Term B-1 Loan, a Term B-1 euro loan facility in the aggregate principal amount of 900 million, equivalent to $978 million as of February 1, 2016, or the Term B-1 Euro Loan, a Term B-2 loan facility in the aggregate principal amount of $500 million, or the Term B-2 Loan, and together with the Term A Loan, Term B-1 Loan, and Term B-1 Euro Loan, referred to as the 2016 Term Loans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Credit Agreement also provides for a revolving credit facility, or the 2016 Revolving Credit Facility, that permits us to borrow from time to time in an aggregate principal amount of up to $500 million for working capital and other corporate purposes, including swingline loans of up to $150 million in the aggregate and for the issuance of letters of credit of up to $100 million in the aggregate, which, in the case of swingline loans and letters of credit, reduce the available borrowing capacity under the 2016 Revolving Credit Facility on a dollar for dollar basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our obligations under the 2016 Credit Agreement are guaranteed by certain of our subsidiaries, or the Guarantors, and are collateralized, subject to

sentences.text: The 2016 Term Loan borrowings under the 2016 Credit Agreement on February 1, 2016 principally represented a modification of debt and a partial extinguishment of debt outstanding under the 2014 Credit Agreement as defined below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unamortized debt issuance costs and debt discount from the 2014 Credit Agreement related to the modification will be amortized over the term of the 2016 Credit Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognized $106 million of third-party financing costs related to the 2016 Credit Agreement immediately in interest expense in connection with the modification of debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also recognized a $34 million loss on extinguishment of debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, we made a principal prepayment totaling $610 million on the Term B-1 Loan and fully repaid the 900 million Term B-1 Euro Loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also fully repaid the $500 million Term B-2 Loan, which was partially funded with $325 million of additional Term A Loan borrowings incurred pursuant to an incremental amendment to the 2016 Credit Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, during fiscal year 2016 we wrote-off $40 million of debt issuance costs, which were included in loss on extinguishment of debt in the consolidated statements of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment to 2016 Credit Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On August 2, 2016, three Broadcom subsidiaries, together with a group of lenders, including Bank of America, N.A., as the administrative agent and collateral agent, entered into three amendments to the 2016 Credit Agreement, referred to as the August 2016 Amendments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amendments were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Second Incremental Term A Facility Amendment, pursuant to which we incurred an additional $2,994 million of Term A Loans, which were used to repay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) $2,521 million of outstanding Term B-1 Loans and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) $473 million of outstanding Term A Loan by certain non-continuing lenders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the First Amendment pursuant to which we
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) incurred $6,595 million of new Term B-3 loans, which were used to repay all of the then outstanding Term B-1 Loan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) reduced the applicable margins on the Term B-3 Loans; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Second Amendment pursuant to which the Term A Loan and 2016 Revolving Credit Facility lenders agreed to certain changes to the 2016 Credit Agreement to increase our operating flexibility, including the automatic release of all collateral securing the 2016 Term Loans upon
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) repayment of all outstanding Term B-3 Loans and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) our achievement of the specified investment grade ratings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Term A Loans incurred in August 2016 have the same terms as the existing Term A Loans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Term B-3 Loan matures on February 1, 2023 (the same date as the prior Term B-1 Loan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the August 2016 Amendments, we wrote-off $49 million of debt issuance costs, which were included in loss on extinguishment of debt in the consolidated statements of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Credit Agreement includes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a financial covenant that requires a first lien leverage ratio of less than 3.9:1;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) customary restrictive covenants (subject, in each case, to certain exceptions and amounts) that limit our ability to, among other things, incur indebtedness, create liens, merge or consolidate with and into other persons, pay dividends or make other distributions on, redeem or repurchase shares or make other restricted payments, make acquisitions and investments and sell assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) customary events of default, upon the occurrence of which, after any applicable grace period, the lenders will have the ability to accelerate all outstanding loans thereunder and terminate the commitments; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) customary representations and warranties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were in compliance with all of the covenants described in the 2016 Credit Agreement as of October 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, subject to certain conditions and availability of commitments, we have the ability to increase the aggregate 2016 Term Loans and/or 2016 Revolving Credit Facility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Term Loans under the 2016 Credit Agreement bear interest at floating rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of October 30, 2016, there were no borrowings outstanding under the 2016 Revolving Credit Facility or any material outstanding letters of credit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of October 30, 2016, the unamortized debt issuance costs related to the 2016 Revolving Credit Facility were $9 million and were included in other long-term assets on the consolidated balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, the accretion of discount and amortization of debt issuance costs related to the 2016 Term Loans and 2016 Revolving Credit Facility was $32 million and was included in interest expense in the consolidated statements of operations.

sentences.text: 2014 Term Loans and Revolving Credit Facility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year ended November 2, 2014, certain of Avagos subsidiaries entered into a collateralized credit agreement with the lenders named therein, or the 2014 Credit Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2014 Credit Agreement provided for a term loan facility of $4,600 million, or the 2014 Term Loans, and a revolving credit facility, or the 2014 Revolving Credit Facility, which permitted certain of Avagos subsidiaries to borrow up to $500 million.

sentences.text: Convertible Senior Notes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the LSI acquisition on May 6, 2014, Avago completed a private placement of $1 billion in aggregate principal amount of the Convertible Notes to two entities affiliated with Silver Lake Partners, or the Purchasers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Convertible Notes were unsecured senior obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest was payable on the Convertible Notes, semi-annually in arrears, at a rate of 2.0% per year and the Convertible Notes were scheduled to mature on August 15, 2021.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon conversion, the Convertible Notes could be settled in Avago ordinary shares, cash or a combination of cash and ordinary shares, at Avagos option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2015, the Purchasers converted all of the Convertible Notes that they held in exchange for cash and Avago ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal years 2015 and 2014, we recognized interest expense of $18 million and $15 million, espectively, related to the coupon interest and accretion of debt discount for the Convertible Notes.

sentences.text: The fair value of our 2016 Term Loans is determined using inputs based on discounted cash flow models with observable market inputs and takes into consideration variables such as interest rate changes, comparable instruments, and credit-rating changes and, therefore, is classified as Level 2.

sentences.text: 9. Shareholders Equity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the period from November 2, 2015 to January 31, 2016, our shareholders equity reflected Avagos outstanding ordinary shares, all of which were publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the Broadcom Transaction, our ownership interest changed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Avago Scheme, Broadcom issued 278 million ordinary shares to holders of Avago ordinary shares and issued 112 million ordinary shares to former BRCM shareholders pursuant to the Broadcom Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the number of Broadcom ordinary shares outstanding increased from 278 million Avago ordinary shares on January 31, 2016 to 390 million Broadcom ordinary shares on February 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both Avago and BRCM became indirect subsidiaries of Broadcom and the Partnership, and Broadcom is the sole General Partner of the Partnership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the carrying amount of equity attributable to Broadcom was adjusted to reflect the change in our ownership interest of our subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, Broadcom reflects a noncontrolling interest in its shareholders equity, which represents the interest of the holders of the Limited Partners in Partnership, as further discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the Broadcom Merger, Broadcom also issued 23 million non-economic voting preference shares, or the Special Voting Shares, which is equal to the number of issued Partnership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All issued ordinary shares are fully paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no par value for these ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Noncontrolling Interest
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Noncontrolling interest represents equity interests in consolidated subsidiaries that are not attributable to Broadcom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of October 30, 2016, the Limited Partners held a noncontrolling interest of approximately 5% in the Partnership through their ownership of 23 million Partnership REUs, issued to former BRCM shareholders pursuant to the Broadcom Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of the Partnership Agreement, each Partnership REU is entitled to distributions from the Partnership in an amount equal to any dividends or distributions that Broadcom declares and pays with respect to Broadcom ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each holder of a Partnership REU is entitled to vote with respect to matters on which holders of Broadcom ordinary shares are entitled to vote by directing the voting trustee to vote one Special Voting Share for each Partnership REU they hold, pursuant to the Voting Trust Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the first anniversary of the Acquisition Date, subject to certain additional requirements and potential deferrals as set forth in the Partnership Agreement, a Limited Partner will have the right to require the Partnership to repurchase some or all of the Limited Partners Partnership REUs in consideration for, as determined by Broadcom in its sole discretion, either one Broadcom ordinary share or a cash amount as determined under the Partnership Agreement for each Partnership REU submitted for repurchase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadcom adjusts the net income (loss) in our consolidated statements of operations to exclude the noncontrolling interests proportionate share of the results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Broadcom presents the proportionate share of equity attributable to the noncontrolling interest as a separate component of shareholders equity within our consolidated balance sheet and statement of shareholders equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Incentive Award Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share-based incentive awards are provided to employees, directors and other persons who provide services to the Partnership or our subsidiaries under the terms of various Broadcom equity incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective December 1, 2005, Broadcom adopted two equity-based compensation plans, the Equity Incentive Plan for Executive Employees of Avago Technologies Limited and Subsidiaries, or the Executive Plan, and the Equity Incentive Plan for Senior Management Employees of Avago Technologies Limited and Subsidiaries, or the Senior Management Plan, together with the Executive Plan, referred to as the Pre-IPO Equity Incentive Plans, which authorized the grant of options and share purchase rights covering up to 30 million ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since our IPO in August 2009, we are no longer permitted to make any further grants under the Pre-IPO Equity Incentive Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options issued under the Executive Plan generally vest at a rate of 20% per year based on the passage of time, and the passage of time and attaining certain performance criteria, in each case subject to continued employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those options subject to vesting based on the passage of time may accelerate by one year upon certain terminations of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options issued under the Senior Management Plan, generally vested at a rate of 20% per year based on the passage of time and continued employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options issued under the Pre-IPO Equity Incentive Plans generally expire ten years following the date of grant unless granted o a non-employee, in which case the awards generally expire five years following the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All options awarded under hese plans were granted with an exercise price equal to the fair market value on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2009, our Board adopted, and our shareholders approved, the Avago Technologies Limited 2009 Equity Incentive Award Plan, or the 2009 Plan, to authorize the grant of options, share appreciation rights, RSUs, dividend equivalents, performance awards, and other share-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A total of 20 million ordinary shares were initially reserved for issuance under the 2009 Plan, subject to annual increases starting in fiscal year 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the annual increase is equal to the least of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) 6 million shares,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) 3% of the ordinary shares outstanding on the last day of the immediately preceding fiscal year and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) such smaller number of ordinary shares as determined by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, no more than 90 million ordinary shares may be issued upon the exercise of equity awards issued under the 2009 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2009 Plan became effective on July 27, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options issued to employees under the 2009 Plan prior to March 2011 generally expire ten years following the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since March 2011, options issued to employees under the 2009 Plan generally expire seven years after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options awarded to non-employees under this plan generally expire after five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options issued to employees under the 2009 Plan generally vest over a four-year period from the date of grant and are granted with an exercise price equal to the fair market value on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any share options cancelled or forfeited under the Pre-IPO Equity Incentive Plans after July 27, 2009 become available for issuance under the 2009 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also grant RSUs as part of our equity compensation programs under the 2009 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An RSU is an equity award that is granted with an exercise price equal to zero and which represents the right to receive one of our ordinary shares immediately upon vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSU awards granted to employees are generally time-based and vest over four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the LSI acquisition, we assumed the LSI 2003 Equity Incentive Plan, or the 2003 Plan, and outstanding unvested stock options and RSUs originally granted by LSI under the 2003 Plan that were held by continuing employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of the acquisition, these awards were converted to Avago share options and RSUs, with adjustments made to the exercise price of stock options and the number of shares subject to stock options and RSU awards so that the intrinsic value of each award was approximately the same immediately before and immediately after the adjustment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These unvested options and RSUs will vest in accordance with their original terms, generally vesting in equal annual installments over a four-year period from the original grant date and expire seven years after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2003 Plan, we may grant to former employees of LSI and other employees who were not employees of Avago at the time of the acquisition restricted stock awards, RSUs, share options and share appreciation rights with an exercise price that is no less than the fair market value on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No participant may be granted share options covering more than four million shares or more than an aggregate of one million shares of restricted stock and RSUs in any fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards granted under the 2003 Plan following the LSI acquisition are expected to be on similar terms and consistent with similar grants made pursuant to the 2009 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the Broadcom Merger, we assumed the BRCM 2012 Stock Incentive Plan, or the 2012 Plan, and outstanding unvested RSUs originally granted by BRCM under the 2012 Plan that were held by continuing employees.

sentences.text: The ESPP provides eligible employees with the opportunity to acquire an ownership interest in us through periodic payroll deductions, based on a 6-month look-back period, at a price equal to the lesser of 85% of the fair market value of the ordinary shares at either the beginning or ending of the relevant offering period.

sentences.text: The ESPP is structured as a qualified employee stock purchase plan under Section 423 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the Broadcom Merger, we assumed RSUs originally granted by BRCM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share-based compensation expense reported in continuing operations in fiscal year 2016 included $222 million related to the assumed BRCM RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our historical experience of pre-vesting option cancellations, we assumed an annualized forfeiture rate for our options of 5% in each of fiscal years 2015 and 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We no longer assume forfeiture for options as all options are vesting on a monthly basis from fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have assumed an annualized forfeiture rate for RSUs of 5%, 3% and 2% for fiscal years 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will recognize additional expense if actual forfeitures are lower than we estimated, and will recognize a benefit if actual forfeitures are higher than we estimated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The income tax benefits for share-based compensation expense were $89 million and $130 million for fiscal years 2016 and 2015, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We estimate the fair value of time-based RSUs using the closing market price of our ordinary shares on the date of grant, reduced by the present value of dividends expected to be paid on our ordinary shares prior to vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We estimate the fair value of market-based awards on the date of grant using the Monte Carlo simulation technique.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We estimate the grant-date fair value of time-based options and employee share purchase plan rights using the Black-Scholes valuation model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The risk-free interest rate was derived from the average U.S. Treasury Strips rate during the period, which approximated the rate in effect at the time of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The dividend yield was based on the historical and expected dividend payouts as of the respective award grant dates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expected volatility was based on Broadcoms own historical share price volatility over the period commensurate with the expected life of the awards and the implied volatility from its own traded ordinary shares with a term of 180 days measured at a specific date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expected term of market-based share options valued using Monte Carlo simulation techniques was based upon the vesting dates forecasted by the simulation and then assuming that share options which vest, and for which the market condition has been satisfied, are exercised at the midpoint between the forecasted vesting date and their expiration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expected term of market-based RSUs valued using Monte Carlo simulation techniques was commensurate with the awards contractual terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expected term for time-based options was based on a weighted-average combining the average life of options that have already been exercised or cancelled with the expected life of all unexercised options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expected life for unexercised options was calculated assuming that the options will be exercised at the midpoint of the vesting date (if unvested) or the valuation date (if vested) and the full contractual term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the above assumptions, the weighted-average fair value of time and market-based options granted under our equity incentive award plans for fiscal year 2015 was $25.30 per share.
