sentences.text: Components of Provision for Income Taxes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have obtained several tax incentives from the Singapore Economic Development Board, an agency of the Government of Singapore, which provide that qualifying income we earn in Singapore are subject to tax holidays or reduced rates of Singapore income tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each such tax incentive is separate and distinct from the others, and may be granted, withheld, extended, modified, truncated, complied with or terminated independently without any effect on the other incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to retain these tax benefits in Singapore, we must meet certain operating conditions specific to each incentive relating to, among other things, maintenance of a corporate headquarters function and specified intellectual property, or IP, activities in Singapore.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Singapore tax incentives are presently scheduled to expire at various dates generally between 2020 and 2025, subject in certain cases to potential extensions, which we may or may not be able to obtain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have tax holidays on our qualifying income in Malaysia, which are scheduled to expire between 2018 and 2028.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tax incentives that we have negotiated in Malaysia are also subject to our compliance with various operating and other conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we cannot, or elect not to, comply with the operating conditions included in any particular tax incentive, we will ose the related tax benefits and we could be required to refund previously realized material tax benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effect of all these tax incentives and tax holidays, in the aggregate, was to reduce the overall provision for income taxes by approximately $169 million and $207 million, for fiscal years 2016 and 2015, respectively, reduce diluted net loss per share by $0.44 for fiscal year 2016 and increase diluted net income per share by $0.74 for fiscal years 2015, respectively.

sentences.text: 11. Segment Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reportable Segments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have four reportable segments: wired infrastructure, wireless communications, enterprise storage and industrial & other.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These segments align with our principal target markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The segments represent components for which separate financial information is available that is utilized on a regular basis by the Chief Executive Officer of Broadcom, who has been identified as the Chief Operating
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decision Maker, or the CODM, as defined by authoritative guidance on segment reporting, in determining how to allocate resources and evaluate performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The segments are determined based on several factors, including client base, homogeneity of products, technology, delivery channels and similar economic characteristics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wired Infrastructure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide semiconductor solutions for enabling all types of set-top boxes and the digital subscriber line, cable and fiber broadband access markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide a wide variety of semiconductor solutions which manage the movement of data in data center, telecom, enterprise and Small-and-Medium size Business/Remote-Office-Branch-Office networking applications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer a broad set of standard Ethernet switching technology to deliver system-on-chip, or SoCs, for high performance compute applications, we supply high speed Serializer/Deserializer technology integrated into application specific integrated circuits, or ASICs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition we provide physical layer devices which are transceivers that enable the reception and transmission of Ethernet data packets over a physical medium such as copper wire or optical fibers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also supply optical laser and receiver components to the storage, Ethernet networking, access, metro and long-haul telecommunication markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wireless Communications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We support the wireless communications industry with a broad variety of radio frequency, or RF, semiconductor devices that amplify, as well as selectively filter, RF signals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to RF devices, we provide a variety of optoelectronic sensors for mobile handset applications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide connectivity solutions that include discrete and integrated Wi-Fi and Bluetooth solutions, location controllers and touch controllers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enterprise Storage
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our enterprise storage products enable secure movement of digital data to and from host machines such as servers, personal computers and storage systems to the underlying storage devices such as hard disk drives, or HDDs and solid state drives, or SSDs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide read channel-based SoCs and preamplifiers to HDD original equipment manufacturers, or OEMs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we sell preamplifiers, which are used to amplify the initial signal to and from the drive disk heads so the signal can be processed by the read channel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide custom flash controllers to SSD OEMs, and Serial attached small computer system interface and Redundant Array of Independent Disks controller and adapter solutions to server and storage system OEMs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide Fibre Channel Host Bus Adapters, which connect host computers such as servers to Fibre Channel Storage Area Networks, or FC SANs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FC SANs are networks dedicated
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reportable Segments (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enterprise Storage (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to storage traffic and enable simultaneous high speed and secure connections among multiple host computers and multiple storage arrays.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide interconnect semiconductors that support the PCIe communication standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Industrial & Other
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a broad variety of products for the general industrial and automotive markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer optical isolators, or optocouplers, which provide electrical insulation and signal isolation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For industrial motors and robotic motion control, we supply optical encoders, as well as integrated circuits for the controller and decoder functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For electronic signs and signals, we supply Light Emitting Diode assemblies that offer high brightness and stable light output over thousands of hours, enabling us to support traffic signals, large commercial signs and other displays.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For industrial networking, we provide faster optical transceivers using plastic optical fiber that enable quick and interoperable networking and factory automation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CODM assesses the performance of each segment and allocates resources to those segments based on net revenue and operating income (loss) and does not evaluate operating segments using discrete asset information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating income (loss) by segment includes items that are directly attributable to each segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating income (loss) by segment also includes shared expenses such as global operations, including manufacturing support, logistics and quality control, which are allocated primarily based on headcount, expenses associated with our globally integrated support organizations, such as sales and corporate marketing functions, as well as finance, information technology, human resources, legal and related corporate infrastructure costs, along with certain benefit related expenses, which are allocated primarily based on a percentage of revenue, and facilities allocated based on square footage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unallocated Expenses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unallocated expenses include amortization of acquisition-related intangible assets, share-based compensation expense, restructuring, impairment and disposal charges, acquisition-related costs, including charges related to inventory step-up to fair value, and other costs, which are not used in evaluating the results of, or in allocating resources to, our segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acquisition- related costs also include transaction costs and any costs directly related to the acquisition and integration of acquired businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depreciation expense directly attributable to each reportable segment is included in operating income (loss) for each segment However, the CODM does not evaluate depreciation expense by operating segment and, therefore, it is not separately presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There was no inter-segment revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lawsuits Relating to the Brocade Merger
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On December 13, 2016, December 15, 2016, and December 21, 2016, four putative class action complaints were filed in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, entitled Steinberg v. Brocade Communications Systems, Inc., et al., No. 3:16-cv-7081-EMC, Gross v. Brocade Communications Systems, Inc., et al., No. 3:16-cv-7173-EJD, Jha v. Brocade Communications Systems, Inc., et al., No. 3:16-cv-7270-HRL, and Bragan v. Brocade Communications Systems, Inc., et al., No. 3:16-cv-7271-JSD, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Steinberg and Bragan complaints name as defendants Brocade, the members of Brocades board of directors, Broadcom Limited, BRCM, and Merger Sub.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Gross and Jha complaints name as defendants Brocade and the members of Brocades board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the complaints assert claims under Sections 14(a) and 20(a) of the Exchange Act and Rule 14a-9 promulgated thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complaints allege, among other things, that the board of directors of Brocade failed to provide material information and/or omitted material information from the Preliminary Proxy Statement filed with the SEC on December 6, 2016 by Brocade.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complaints seek to enjoin the closing of the transaction between Brocade and Broadcom, as well as certain other equitable and declaratory relief and attorneys fees and costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A hearing for final approval is scheduled for February 27, 2017.

sentences.text: On March 11, 2015, a third complaint was filed in the Delaware Court of Chancery, captioned Hoai Vu v. Emulex Corporation, et al., Case No. 10776-VCL (Del. Ch.).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complaints alleged, among other things, that Emulexs directors breached their fiduciary duties by approving the Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated February 25, 2015, by and among AT Wireless, Merger Sub and Emulex, or the Merger Agreement, and that AT Wireless and Merger Sub aided and abetted these alleged breaches of fiduciary duty.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complaints sought, among other things, either to enjoin the transaction or to rescind it following its completion, as well as damages, including attorneys and experts fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Delaware Court of Chancery has entered an order consolidating the three Delaware actions under the caption In re Emulex Corporation Stockholder Litigation, Consolidated C.A. No. 10743-VCL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On May 5, 2015, we completed our acquisition of Emulex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On June 5, 2015, the Court of Chancery dismissed the consolidated action without prejudice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On April 8, 2015, a putative class action complaint was filed in the United States District Court for the Central District of California, entitled Gary Varjabedian, et al. v. Emulex Corporation, et al., No. 8:15-cv-554-CJC-JCG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complaint names as defendants Emulex, its directors, AT Wireless and Merger Sub, and purported to assert claims under Sections 14
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) and 20(a) of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complaint alleged, among other things, that the board of directors of Emulex failed to provide material information and/or omitted material information from the Solicitation/Recommendation Statement on Schedule 14D-9 filed with the SEC on April 7, 2015 by Emulex, together with the exhibits and annexes thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complaint sought to enjoin the tender offer to purchase all of the outstanding shares of Emulex common stock, as well as certain other equitable relief and attorneys fees and costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On July 28, 2015, the court issued an order appointing the lead plaintiff and approving lead counsel for the putative class.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On September 9, 2015, plaintiff filed a first amended complaint seeking rescission of the merger, unspecified money damages, other equitable relief and attorneys fees and costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On October 13, 2015, defendants moved to dismiss the first amended complaint, which the court granted with prejudice on January 13, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plaintiff filed a notice of appeal to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit on January 15, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The appeal is captioned Gary Varjabedian, et al. v. Emulex Corporation, et al., No. 16-55088.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On June 27, 2016, the Plaintiff-Appellant filed his opening brief, on August 17 and August 22, 2016, the Defendants-Appellees filed their answering briefs, and on October 5, 2016 Plaintiff- Appellant filed his reply brief.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lawsuits Relating to the Acquisition of PLX
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June and July 2014, four lawsuits were filed in the Superior Court for the State of California, County of Santa Clara challenging our acquisition of PLX.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On July 22, 2014, the court consolidated these California actions under the caption In re PLX Technology, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sholder Litig.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: , Lead Case No. 1-14-CV-267079 (Cal. Super. Ct., Santa Clara) and appointed lead counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That same day, the court also stayed the consolidated action, pending resolution of related actions filed in the Delaware Court of Chancery, described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in June and July 2014, five similar lawsuits were filed in the Delaware Court of Chancery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On July 21, 2014, the court consolidated these Delaware actions under the caption In re PLX Technology, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders Litigation, Consol.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C.A. No. 9880-VCL (Del. Ch.), appointed lead plaintiffs and lead counsel, and designated an operative complaint for the consolidated action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On July 31, 2014, counsel for lead plaintiffs in Delaware informed the court that they would not seek a preliminary injunction, but intend to seek damages and pursue monetary remedies through post-closing litigation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our acquisition of PLX closed on August 12, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On October 31, 2014, lead plaintiffs filed a consolidated amended complaint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This complaint alleges, among other things, that PLXs directors breached their fiduciary duties to PLXs stockholders by seeking to sell PLX for an inadequate price, pursuant to an unfair process, and by agreeing to preclusive deal protections in the merger agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plaintiffs also allege that Potomac Capital Partners II, L.P., Deutsche Bank Securities, Avago Technologies Wireless (U.S.A.) Manufacturing Inc., or AT Wireless, and Pluto Merger Sub, Inc., the acquisition subsidiary, aided and abetted the alleged fiduciary breaches.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plaintiffs also allege that PLXs Solicitation/Recommendation statement on Schedule 14D-9, as filed with the SEC, contained false and misleading statements and/or omitted material information necessary to inform the shareholder vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plaintiffs seek, among other things, monetary damages and attorneys fees and costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On September 3, 2015, the court granted motions to dismiss filed by AT Wireless, the acquisition subsidiary and two PLX directors, and denied motions to dismiss filed by several other PLX directors, Potomac Capital Partners II, L.P. and Deutsche Bank Securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On August 17, 2016, the five remaining PLX director-defendants and Deutsche Bank Securities entered into a stipulation of partial settlement to resolve claims against all of the former PLX directors and Deutsche Bank Securities asserted in the Delaware class action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The partial settlement also provides for a release of all potential claims against AT Wireless, Pluto Merger Sub, Avago and PLX.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defendant Potomac Capital Partners II, L.P. is not a party to the settlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This partial settlement is subject to court approval following notice to the putative class of PLX shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A hearing on the settlement was held on November 17, 2016, and the matter was taken under submission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Delaware class litigation is on-going.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the matters discussed above, we are currently engaged in a number of legal actions in the ordinary course of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not believe, based on currently available facts and circumstances, that the final outcome of any pending legal proceedings, taken individually or as a whole, will have a material adverse effect on our financial condition, results of operations or cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, lawsuits may involve complex questions of fact and law and may require the expenditure of significant funds and other resources to defend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of litigation are inherently uncertain, and material adverse outcomes are possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, we may enter into confidential discussions regarding the potential settlement of such lawsuits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any settlement of pending litigation could require us to incur substantial costs and other ongoing expenses, such as future royalty payments in the case of an intellectual property dispute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the periods presented, no material amounts have been accrued or disclosed in the accompanying consolidated financial statements with respect to loss contingencies associated with any legal proceedings, as potential losses for such matters are not considered probable and ranges of losses are not reasonably estimable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These matters are subject to many uncertainties and the ultimate outcomes are not predictable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There can be no assurances that the actual amounts required to satisfy any liabilities arising from the matters described above will not have a material adverse effect on our results of operations, financial position or cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Warranty
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accrue for the estimated costs of product warranties at the time revenue is recognized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Product warranty costs are estimated based upon our historical experience and specific identification of the products requirements, which may fluctuate based on product mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we accrue for warranty costs associated with occasional or unanticipated product quality issues if a loss is probable and can be reasonably estimated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Indemnifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As is customary in our industry and as provided for in local law in the United States and other jurisdictions, many of our standard contracts provide remedies to our customers and others with whom we enter into contracts, such as defense, settlement, or payment of judgment for intellectual property claims related to the use of our products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, we indemnify customers, as well as our suppliers, contractors, lessors, lessees, companies that purchase our businesses or assets and others with whom we enter into contracts, against combinations of loss, expense, or liability arising from various triggering events related to the sale and the use of our products, the use of their goods and services, the use of facilities and state of our owned facilities, the state of the assets and businesses that we sell and other matters covered by such contracts, usually up to a specified maximum amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, from time to time we also provide protection to these parties against
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14. Restructuring, Impairment and Disposal Charges
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restructuring charges
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal years 2016 and 2015, we initiated a series of restructuring activities intended to realign our operations to improve overall efficiency and effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a summary of significant restructuring expense recognized in continuing operations, primarily operating expenses, for the periods specified below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the Broadcom Merger, we began the implementation of cost reduction activities, including the expected elimination of a total of approximately 3,100 positions from our workforce across all business and functional areas on a global basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, we recognized $418 million and $29 million of employee termination costs and lease exits costs, respectively, primarily associated with the Broadcom Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of October 30, 2016 approximately 1,900 positions were eliminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect to substantially complete the restructuring activities related to the Broadcom Merger in fiscal year 2017, and expect to incur additional costs in fiscal year 2017 primarily for termination benefits for employees on long-term transition plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2015, we recognized $34 million and $11 million of employee termination costs and lease and other exit costs, respectively, for restructuring activities in connection with the Emulex acquisition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2015, we recognized $26 million of employee termination costs and $6 million of lease and other exit costs for restructuring activities in connection with the acquisition of LSI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impairment and Disposal Charges
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, we recorded $417 million of impairment charges in our wireless communications segment and wired infrastructure segment for IPR&D projects which were abandoned as a result of integration of BRCM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we recorded impairment charges of $173 million primarily for property, plant and equipment acquired through the Broadcom Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2015, we realigned certain product groups within our wired infrastructure segment and agreed to sell certain fiber optics subsystem assets to a third party, resulting in a $61 million loss to write these assets down to fair value less costs to sell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, we recorded a $16 million loss on disposal of these assets.
